data.title: What's the difference between a variable that is: null, undefined or undeclared? How would you go about checking for any of these states?
data.desc: Undeclared variables are created when you assign a value to an identifier that is not previously created using var, let or const...

data.title: Can you describe the main difference between a .forEach loop and a .map() loop and why you would pick one versus the other?
data.desc: The main difference between .forEach and .map() is that .map() returns a new array. If you need the result, but do not wish to mutate the original array, .map() is the clear choice. If you simply need to iterate over an array, forEach is a fine choice...

data.title: What's a typical use case for anonymous functions?
data.desc: They can be used in IIFEs to encapsulate some code within a local scope so that variables declared in it do not leak to the global scope...

data.title: How do you organize your code? (module pattern, classical inheritance?
data.desc: In the past, I've used Backbone for my models which encourages a more OOP approach, creating Backbone models and attaching methods to them.
